body.head: Franz Blei (born Vienna, Jan 18, 1871; died New York, July 10, 1942)

div.p: Franz Blei (born Vienna, Jan 18, 1871; died New York, July 10, 1942), Viennese essayist, playwright, and translator. He translated into German, among other things, works by Walt Whitman, Oscar Wilde, and Molière. From 1908 to 1910, he edited the journal Hyperion, which was the first to publish work by the young Franz Kafka.
